removals.reasoning: Redundant outer parentheses around a function argument; they do not affect parsing or precedence.
The expression being cast does not need extra parentheses; cast binds tightly.
Redundant outer parentheses around a function argument.
Extra parentheses around the inner cast expression are unnecessary.
Redundant outer parentheses around a function argument.
Extra parentheses around the inner cast expression are unnecessary.
Redundant outer parentheses around a function argument.
Extra parentheses around the inner cast expression are unnecessary.
Redundant outer parentheses around a function argument.
Extra parentheses around the inner cast expression are unnecessary.
Parentheses around single variables in a cast are unnecessary, and the outermost grouping around the whole RHS adds no clarity.
Parentheses around single variables in casts and the outermost grouping are unnecessary; numerator grouping is retained to preserve precedence over division.
Same as above: remove redundant variable and outer parentheses; keep numerator grouping for precedence.
Same as above: remove redundant variable and outer parentheses; keep numerator grouping for precedence.
Parentheses inside array subscript are unnecessary; operator precedence makes the expression unambiguous.
Remove parentheses around single variables in casts and unnecessary grouping around the product and the entire RHS; * and / have equal precedence and left associativity.
Inner parentheses around (num + factor) are unnecessary because + and - share precedence and are left-associative. The outer parentheses (around the whole numerator) are still needed due to division.
Outer grouping around the RHS of assignment is unnecessary.
Parentheses around a simple product are unnecessary since * has higher precedence than +.
Parentheses inside array subscript are unnecessary.
Outer grouping around the RHS of assignment is unnecessary.
Parentheses around a simple product are unnecessary since * has higher precedence than +.
Parentheses inside array subscript are unnecessary.
Parentheses around the address-of operand and around the casted expression are unnecessary; cast and & have clear precedence.
Same as above: remove unnecessary parentheses around &operand and the overall cast expression.
Same pattern: extra parentheses around &operand and cast expression are redundant.
Same pattern: extra parentheses around &operand and cast expression are redundant.
Same pattern: remove redundant parentheses around &operand and the overall cast expression.
Same pattern: remove redundant parentheses around &operand and the overall cast expression.
Same pattern: remove redundant parentheses around &operand and the overall cast expression.
Same pattern: remove redundant parentheses around &operand and the overall cast expression.
Parentheses around a single variable used as a function argument are unnecessary.
